Package projects.phonebook.hashes

Interface HashTable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LinearProbingHashTable, OpenAddressingHashTable, OrderedLinearProbingHashTable, QuadraticProbingHashTable, SeparateChainingHashTable
    public interface HashTable

    HashTable is an abstraction over hash tables which store String keys and map to String values. Implementing classes should offer amortized constant insertion, search and deletion. The method names that you have to implement are the namesakes of Hashtable (not HashMap!).

    **** DO NOT EDIT THIS INTERFACE'S DECLARATION! ******

    *
    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    OpenAddressingHashTable, SeparateChainingHashTable, LinearProbingHashTable, OrderedLinearProbingHashTable, QuadraticProbingHashTable

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int capacity()
      Returns the capacity of this HashTable.
      boolean containsKey​(java.lang.String key)
      Queries the HashTable about the existence of the key key in its internal storage.
      boolean containsValue​(java.lang.String value)
      Queries the HashTable about the existence of the value value in its internal storage.
      Probes get​(java.lang.String key)
      Get the value associated with key in the HashTable.
      Probes put​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Inserts the pair <key, value> into this.
      Probes remove​(java.lang.String key)
      Return and remove the value associated with key in the HashTable.
      int size()
      Returns the number of records in this HashTable.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        Probes put​(java.lang.String key,
           java.lang.String value)
        Inserts the pair <key, value> into this. The container should not allow for null keys and values, and we will test if you are throwing a IllegalArgumentException from your code if this method is given null arguments! It is important that we establish that no null entries can exist in our database because the semantics of get(String) and remove(String) are that they return null if, and only if, their key parameter is null. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Parameters:
        key - The record's key.
        value - The record's value.
        Returns:
        The Probes with the value added and the number of probes it makes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null.

      • get

        Probes get​(java.lang.String key)
        Get the value associated with key in the HashTable. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        The Probes with associated value and the number of probe used. If the key is null, return value null and 0 as number of probes; if the key dones't exists in the database, return null and the number of probes used.

      • remove

        Probes remove​(java.lang.String key)
        Return and remove the value associated with key in the HashTable. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        The Probes with associated value and the number of probe used. If the key is null, return value null and 0 as number of probes; if the key dones't exists in the database, return null and the number of probes used.

      • containsKey

        boolean containsKey​(java.lang.String key)
        Queries the HashTable about the existence of the key key in its internal storage. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        true if key is the key of some record in our hash table, false otherwise.

      • containsValue

        boolean containsValue​(java.lang.String value)
        Queries the HashTable about the existence of the value value in its internal storage. This method is expected to run in linear time (i.e containsValue() is expected to be an inefficient operation. This is to be expected, since this HashTable hashes \ keys, not values.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to search for.
        Returns:
        true if key is the key of some record in our hash table, false otherwise.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the number of records in this HashTable. Please note that this is not the same as returning the hash table's capacity in Open Addressing collision resolution schemes (like Linear Probing)!
        Returns:
        The number of records stored in this.

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Returns the capacity of this HashTable. In Separate Chaining, this is the total number of cells from which the lists begin. In Open Addressing methods, this method returns the size of the underlying array. As a consequence, in SeparateChainingHashTable, it's possible for size() to return a value larger than this method. On the other hand, for Open Addressing methods like LinearProbingHashTable and QuadraticProbingHashTable, the value returned by this method is an upper bound on the value returned by size().
        Returns:
        the number of cells in the table.
